titlestmt.titleproper: Michael T. Martin Collection, 1935-2016, bulk 1988-2006 COL 30
titlestmt.subtitle: A Guide to His Papers at the Indiana University Black Film Center/Archive
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Rachel Condon

note.p: © 2019 Trustees of Indiana University. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-07-02 04:01:55 -0400.

change.item: Finding aid created by Rachel Condon

did.unittitle: Michael T. Martin Collection

physdesc.extent: 8 boxes + 6 videocassettes + 4 video reels + 6 audiocassettes + 2 DVDs + 4 floppy disks + 4 books + 1 index card box

did.abstract: Papers and audiovisual materials from the career of documentarian and Indiana University professor Michael T. Martin.
did.langmaterial: Materials are in English, Spanish, French, and German.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research. Audiovisual materials such as film, audio and videocassettes, audio reels, and audio discs may require the creation of listening copies. If you wish to preview an item in one of these formats, please contact the BFC/A staff well in advance of your visit.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Michael T. Martin is a professor of cinema and media studies, as well as adjunct professor of Latin American and Caribbean studies at Indiana University. Martin's research interests include diasporic cinema, Latin, African, and Caribbean postcolonial cinema, documentary practice, and redress social movements. He has previously taught at Princeton University, Wayne State University, and Bowling Green State University.

Martin has written and edited eight published books, as well as being a frequent contributor to journals in his field. Books include Cinemas of the Black Diaspora: Diversity, Dependence, and Oppositionality, the two-volume series New Latin American Cinema, Redress for Historical Injustices in the United States: On Reparations for Slavery, Jim Crow, and Their Legacies, and Birth of a Nation: The Cinematic Past in the Present.
Journals to which Martin has contributed include Africa Today, Third Text, Quarterly Review of Film and Video, Camera Obscura, Cinema Journal, and Research in African Literatures.

At Indiana University, Martin previously served as the director of the Black Film Center/Archive for nine years before leaving the position in 2017. During this time he founded the scholarly journal Black Camera, of which he remains editor-in-chief. For Black Camera Martin has interviewed filmmakers and scholars such as Bridgett M. Davis, Dany Laferrière, Stanley Nelson, and Ava DuVernay.

In addition to his prolific writing and editing, he also directed the 1988 documentary In the Absence of Peace during his time at Princeton University. The documentary looks at post-revolutionary Nicaraguan society and the social ramifications of the forty year of dictatorship on the Latin American nation.

archdesc.arrangement:
Arrangement Arranged in three series
• Series 1: In the Absence of Peace and filmmaking materials
• Subseries 1.1: Production and distribution materials
• Subseries 1.2: Audiovisual materials
• Subseries 1.3: Exhibition and promotional materials
• Series 2: Materials related to works edited and written by Martin
• Subseries 2.1: Content of Cinemas of the Black Diaspora
• Subseries 2.2: Funding, correspondence, and promotion for Cinemas of the Black Diaspora
• Subseries 2.3: Other Martin writings and edited volumes
• Series 3: Miscellaneous collected materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Papers, videocassettes, audiocassettes, video reels, and other materials from the career of documentarian and Indiana University professor Michael T. Martin. The collection contains research materials, drafts, notes, audiovisual materials, promotional materials, and correspondence related to the documentary In the Absence of Peace, edited book Cinemas of the Black Diaspora, and other edited volumes, articles, and interviews from Martin's career. Also included are assorted collected materials such as academic and popular articles relevant to his areas of research, student dissertations, and documentary video reels.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: One edited volume and three bound student dissertations are kept on the bookshelf at the BFC/A.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Michael T. Martin to the Indiana University Black Film Center Archives on [date].

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [item], Michael T. Martin Collection, Special Collection COL 30, Black Film Center/Archive, Indiana University, Bloomington.

did.unittitle: 1. In the Absence of Peace,

physdesc.extent: 4 boxes + 70 photographs + 2 video reels + 5 videocassettes + 6 audiocassettes + 2 video disks + 2 floppy disks + 1 index card box

did.unittitle: 1.1 In the Absence of Peace production and distribution materials,
In the Absence of Peace production notes,

odd.head: General
odd.p: Notes on the January 1988 trip to Nicaragua for filming. Includes a spiral bound Princeton notebook with production notes inside.

did.unittitle: Interview transcripts, tapes 1-8

odd.head: General
odd.p: Handwritten transcripts of interviews conducted for In the Absence of Peace. Both the Spanish transcript and English translation included.

did.unittitle: Interview transcripts, tapes 9-16

odd.head: General
odd.p: Handwritten transcripts of interviews conducted for In the Absence of Peace. Both the Spanish transcript and English translation included.

did.unittitle: Interview transcripts, tapes 17-28

odd.head: General
odd.p: Handwritten transcripts of interviews conducted for In the Absence of Peace. Both the Spanish transcript and English translation included.

did.unittitle: Interview transcripts, tapes 29-39

odd.head: General
odd.p: Handwritten transcripts of interviews conducted for In the Absence of Peace. Both the Spanish transcript and English translation included.

did.unittitle: Notes and transcripts, introduction through section 4

odd.head: General
odd.p: Post-filming notes on production and annotated transcripts.

did.unittitle: Notes and transcripts, section 5 through conclusion

odd.head: General
odd.p: Post-filming notes on production and annotated transcripts.

did.unittitle: Notes on religion, city, music, footage, and themes

odd.head: General
odd.p: Notes on documentary themes including interview fragments that fit indivudiaul themes. Also includes plans for footage editing, music to be used in the film, and contact people from Nicaragua.

did.unittitle: Documentary outline and development notes

odd.head: General
odd.p: Outline of film accompanied by detailed descriptions of the visuals, audio, and what tapes to use at specified timecodes. Development notes include duplicated documents from folder 8 but with different annotations relevant to the later stages of post-production.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Corresponding floppy disk (3.5") with documents concerning In the Absence of Peace.

did.unittitle: Photographs

physdesc.extent: 24 photographs (color; 3.5 x 5 in) + 17 photographs (color; 4 x 6 in) + 29 photographs (black & white; 4 x 6 in)

odd.head: General
odd.p: Taken during filming of In the Absence of Peace.

did.unittitle: Script draft

odd.head: General
odd.p: In the Absence of Peace script with handwritten edits and annotations.

did.unittitle: Final script

odd.head: General
odd.p: Final draft script for In the Absence of Peace.

did.unittitle: Film treatment, draft synopsis, and credits

odd.head: General
odd.p: Film treatement offering a description of the documentary, a synopsis that would be used in distribution and screening, and other descriptive documents such as a list of project personel.

did.unittitle: Copyrights, releases, and insurance

odd.head: General
odd.p: Documents on copyright registration, music liscensing, and liability insurance for the documentary.

did.unittitle: Brochure and poster production

odd.head: General
odd.p: Fliers for In the Absence of Peace and sample brochures and fliers with annotations for adapting them for Martin's film.

did.unittitle: Broadcast televising of In the Absence of Peace,

odd.head: General
odd.p: Correspondence and notes on the broadcasting of In the Absence of Peace on two public television stations.

did.unittitle: DVD production

odd.head: General
odd.p: Correspondence with IU Radio and TV services with plans for putting In the Absence of Peace on a DVD format. Includes samples of the DVD cover.

did.unittitle: Funding sources

odd.head: General
odd.p: Notes, readings, correspondence, and applications for possible post-production funding sources.

did.unittitle: Distribution materials

odd.head: General
odd.p: Correspondence and applications concerning the film distribution of the documentary.

did.unittitle: Latin American Video Archives distributor correspondence,

odd.head: General
odd.p: Correspondence, sales documents, ad distribution agreement with the Latin American Video Archive. Also includes catalogs and other promotional materials from LAVA.

did.unittitle: Indiana University lecture and screening,

odd.head: General
odd.p: Correspondence, prepared remarks, and articles for research for a lecture and screening at Indiana University, Bloomington.

did.unittitle: Film organization memberships

odd.head: General

did.unittitle: Independent Production Services documents

odd.head: General

did.unittitle: International Black Film Festival

odd.head: General
odd.p: Documents concerning the International Black Film Festival, held annually in multiple locations. Most are from Martin's invitation to attend the 1993 iteration in South Bend, Indiana. Promotional materials for consecutive years included.

did.unittitle: Fountainhead Black International Cinema program,

odd.head: General

did.unittitle: Index card box with contact information

odd.head: General
odd.p: Box of index cards (5.5 x 4 x 3 inch) with contact information for distributors, exhibitions, festivals, and filmmaker groups.

did.unittitle: 2. Written and edited works by Martin

physdesc.extent: 2 boxes + 1 video reel + 2 floppy disks + 1 book

did.unittitle: 2.1 Content of Cinemas of the Black Diaspora,

odd.head: General
odd.p: Materials remain in Martin's original folders when possible. Folders contain correspondence with the authors and publishers of each article as well as reprinting agreements. Organized in the order the pieces appear in the published book.

did.unittitle: Preface

odd.p: Articles about Nicaragua from mixed academic and popular source. Articles reference the Iran-contra affair and Sandinista power struggles.

did.unittitle: Popular and academic articles on Nicaragua

odd.head: General
odd.p: Articles about Nicaragua from mixed academic and popular source. Articles center on Nicaraguan elections of 1996 and their ramifications.

did.unittitle: Popular and academic articles on Nicaragua

odd.head: General
odd.p: Articles about Nicaragua from mixed academic and popular source. Articles discuss US interests in Nicaraguan 2001 elections.

did.unittitle: Popular and academic articles on Nicaragua

odd.head: General
odd.p: Articles about Nicaragua from mixed academic and popular source. Articles focus on the re-election of Sandinista leader Daniel Ortega.

did.unittitle: Popular and academic articles on Nicaragua

odd.head: General
odd.p: Articles about Nicaragua from mixed academic and popular source. Articles explore the Nicaraguan Revolution 30 years later.

did.unittitle: Articles on minorities in the media

odd.head: General
odd.p: Articles exploring minorities, specifically black-Americans and Hispanic-Americans, in television and movies.

did.unittitle: Popular and academic articles on Roots,

odd.head: General
odd.p: Contemporary articles discussing the broadcast of Roots and Roots II, audience demographics, audience reaction, and this portrayal of blacks on television.

did.unittitle: Blacks and White TV,

odd.head: General
odd.p: Book used for research in tandem with articles on Roots. Martin's bookmark opens to statistics on Roots viewership.

did.unittitle: Independent Film Distribution Handbook,

odd.head: General
odd.p: Printout of handbook with guidelines for DIY independent film distribution used for In the Absence of Peace.

did.unittitle: Wayne State University and Bowling Green State University brochures,

odd.head: General
odd.p: Brochures for programs and institutions Martin was associated with at Wayne State University and Bowling Green State University.

did.unittitle: Gordon Parks event,

odd.head: General
odd.p: Screening and lecture event held by the BFC/A. L. Roi Boyd, III presented the Gordon Parks film Leadbelly for the film's 30th anniversary.

did.unittitle: Havana newspapers,

odd.head: General
odd.p: Newspapers in Spanish. Collected in December of 1988 while attending the Havana Film Festival for its exhibition of In the Absence of Peace.

did.unittitle: German-language magazines

odd.head: General
